snippet: The reductions are the second wave of job cuts at Nokia under Steven Elop, a former Microsoft executive.
abstract: Nokia is cutting 4,000 manufacturing jobs, or 7 percent of its global work force, as it moves to streamline operations and save money from its production of smartphones.
lead_paragraph: The reductions are the second wave of job cuts at Nokia under Steven Elop, a former Microsoft executive.

headline.main: Nokia to Cut 4,000 Jobs at 3 Factories
headline.print_headline: Nokia Will Cut 4,000 Jobs In Shifting Phone Production
